intro: Oxytropis komarovii, commonly known as Komarov's locoweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Central Asia and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellow to reddish flowers in late spring, which are clustered in racemes. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in steppes and rocky soils. Oxytropis komarovii is notable for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitats.
